column4: I'm having keyboard problems. I'm running Lucid Lynx, converted from Xubuntu using http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/puregnome. I had the problem before, too. The problem is that, occasionally, keyboard input is ignored entirely. Changing the focus somewhere else and then back again fixes it.
did you get any errors dumped into logs?
Where and how would I check that? A friend of mine looked into that once, and found something. I can't remember how, though
check your logs within /var/log/
Well, I have lots of logs there. Which ones are probably relevant?
i would start by looking in messages.log in about the time you had the issue
Okay. I found this: http://pastebin.com/day5vBCh
which version of ubuntu are you using?
are you using a MS wireless keyboard by any chance?
I'm not. I'm on a netbook (MSI Wind).
not sure if this can help in 10.04 but did you try to stop the hotkey-setup process? [sudo /etc/init.d/hotkey-setup stop]
I get a 'command not found' when I try that.
hmmm k
by any chance do you get the same issue from over an external keyboard (USB) ?
I'll check and see
I've bumbed into a reported bug [Bug #517653] which is almost identical to yours. They have reported that by using an external keyboard the problem fades away
I still get the problem, in the same way.
same errors dumbed too?
hm, not that I can see. But, I also can't really correlate the timing of the other error messages with when I get the problem.

There isn't anything in messages at the exact time of the problem, as far as I can tell. The majority of messages (besides everything associated with booting up) is just like that excerpt I put on pastebin, though.
you need to locate what is causing the issue, tailing the logfiles can be a method
Okay. I've been looking through various ones, and none have fit so far. I'll keep searching, though
I don't see anything. I've checked all of the log files, I believe. I've certainly checked all of the ones that don't seem absurd.
